CatDescriptText: Mr. Joseph Baker, Rankin, and Mr. Eward Herd, 615 Ann Street, Homestead, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 2, 1957, pg. 2, with question: "Do you believe that one political party should be in control of all the offices in the city, county, and state?" Mr. Joseph Baker's answer reads: "I think that it all should be the same. One political party should hold all the offices, like in the borough, the county government, and the state government.  This way it keeps down the fighting and the political differences."  Mr. Eward Herd answer reads: "Yes, I do think so.  This has been good all these years, so why change it now."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of Joseph Baker wearing suede zippered jacket, and Eward Herd, wearing plaid buttoned down shirt, v-neck sweater, and plaid jacket, standing against glass block window of brick building
